nodes.text: A spraynet was a liquefied web that was fired from snare rifles. It would cover a target and solidify to hold the victim in place. The Merr-Sonn GRS-1 snare rifle utilized a liquid spraynet which was fired immediately following a shockstun mist.
The fibers of the spraynet were difficult to break. The GRS-1 liquid spraynet dispenser cost 25 credits and could fire up to twelve shots before the cartridge must be replaced.
